title: Import datetime Module
description: Import datetime module and verify it has 'date' attribute.
hints: datetime is Python's date and time module

title: Get Today's Date
description: Get today's date and verify it's a date object.

title: Get Current DateTime
description: Get current date and time, verify it's a datetime object.

title: Create Specific Date
description: Create date for January 1, 2024 and print it.

title: Create Specific DateTime
description: Create datetime for 2024-01-01 12:30:45 and print it.
hints: Arguments: year, month, day, hour, minute, second

title: Access Date Parts
description: Get year, month, day from date 2024-03-15. Print all three.
testCode:
import datetime
date = datetime.date(2024, 3, 15)
{user_code}
print(year)
print(month)
print(day)

title: Access Time Parts
description: Get hour, minute, second from datetime. Print all three.
testCode:
import datetime
dt = datetime.datetime(2024, 1, 1, 14, 30, 45)
{user_code}
print(hour)
print(minute)
print(second)

title: Get Weekday
description: Get weekday number (0=Monday) for 2024-01-01. Print it.

title: Create Timedelta
description: Create timedelta of 7 days and print it.

title: Add Days to Date
description: Add 10 days to 2024-01-01. Print result.

title: Subtract Dates
description: Calculate days between 2024-01-10 and 2024-01-01. Print the number.
starterCode:
import datetime
date1 = datetime.date(2024, 1, 10)
date2 = datetime.date(2024, 1, 1)
testCode:
import datetime
date1 = datetime.date(2024, 1, 10)
date2 = datetime.date(2024, 1, 1)
{user_code}
print(days)

title: Add Hours to DateTime
description: Add 5 hours to datetime 2024-01-01 10:00:00. Print result.
hints: timedelta supports days, hours, minutes, seconds

title: Format Date with strftime
description: Format 2024-03-15 as 'Mar 15, 2024'. Print result.

title: Parse Date with strptime
description: Parse '2024-03-15' to date object. Print the year.

title: ISO Format
description: Convert datetime 2024-03-15 12:30:45 to ISO format string. Print it.

title: Parse ISO Format
description: Parse ISO string '2024-03-15' to date object. Print the month.

title: DateTime to Timestamp
description: Convert datetime to Unix timestamp. Verify it's a float.
testCode:
import datetime
dt = datetime.datetime(2024, 1, 1, 0, 0, 0)
{user_code}
print(isinstance(timestamp, float))

title: Timestamp to DateTime
description: Convert timestamp 1704067200 to datetime. Print year.

title: Create Time Object
description: Create time object for 14:30:00. Print it.

title: Combine Date and Time
description: Combine date 2024-01-01 with time 12:30:00 to create datetime. Print it.
starterCode:
import datetime
date = datetime.date(2024, 1, 1)
time = datetime.time(12, 30, 0)
testCode:
import datetime
date = datetime.date(2024, 1, 1)
time = datetime.time(12, 30, 0)
{user_code}
print(dt)
hints: Combines separate date and time objects

title: Replace Date Parts
description: Change year of 2024-03-15 to 2025. Print result.

title: Timedelta Total Seconds
description: Create timedelta of 1 hour. Get total seconds. Print it.

title: Compare Dates
description: Check if 2024-01-10 is greater than 2024-01-01. Print True or False.
starterCode:
import datetime
date1 = datetime.date(2024, 1, 10)
date2 = datetime.date(2024, 1, 1)
testCode:
import datetime
date1 = datetime.date(2024, 1, 10)
date2 = datetime.date(2024, 1, 1)
{user_code}

title: Common strftime Patterns
description: Format 2024-03-15 14:30:45 as 'Friday, March 15, 2024 02:30 PM'. Print it.

title: Calculate Age
description: Calculate age in years from birthdate 2000-01-01 to today 2024-01-01. Print age.
starterCode:
import datetime
birthdate = datetime.date(2000, 1, 1)
today = datetime.date(2024, 1, 1)
testCode:
import datetime
birthdate = datetime.date(2000, 1, 1)
today = datetime.date(2024, 1, 1)
{user_code}
print(age)
hints: Adjust if birthday hasn't occurred this year

title: Days Until Event
description: Calculate days from 2024-01-01 to 2024-12-31. Print count.
starterCode:
import datetime
today = datetime.date(2024, 1, 1)
event = datetime.date(2024, 12, 31)
testCode:
import datetime
today = datetime.date(2024, 1, 1)
event = datetime.date(2024, 12, 31)
{user_code}
print(days_until)

title: Check Leap Year
description: Check if 2024 is a leap year. Print True or False.
hints: Try creating Feb 29 for that year

title: First Day of Month
description: Get first day of month for 2024-03-15. Print result.
hints: Keeps year and month, sets day to 1

title: Last Day of Month
description: Get last day of month for March 2024. Print result.
hints: Returns last day number of month

title: Find Next Monday
description: Find next Monday from 2024-01-01 (which is Monday). Print result.
hints: Calculate days to add: (7 - weekday + target_weekday) % 7

title: Get Quarter
description: Determine quarter (1-4) for date 2024-03-15. Print quarter number.
hints: Q1: Jan-Mar, Q2: Apr-Jun, Q3: Jul-Sep, Q4: Oct-Dec

title: Get Week Number
description: Get ISO week number for 2024-01-15. Print it.

title: Measure Duration
description: Calculate duration between 10:00:00 and 15:30:00 in hours. Print it.

title: UTC Time
description: Get current UTC time and verify it's datetime object.
hints: Deprecated in Python 3.12, use timezone-aware datetime

title: Timezone-Aware DateTime
description: Create timezone-aware datetime for UTC. Verify it has timezone info.

title: Parse Common Date Format
description: Parse 'March 15, 2024' to date object. Print month number.

title: Custom Date Format
description: Format 2024-03-15 as '15/03/2024'. Print result.

title: Count Weekdays
description: Count weekdays (Mon-Fri) from 2024-01-01 to 2024-01-07. Print count.

title: Negative Timedelta
description: Subtract 5 days from 2024-01-10. Print result.

title: Min and Max Dates
description: Find minimum and maximum from list of dates. Print both.
testCode:
import datetime
dates = [datetime.date(2024, 3, 15), datetime.date(2024, 1, 1), datetime.date(2024, 6, 30)]
{user_code}
print(min_date)
print(max_date)

title: Sort Dates
description: Sort list of dates [2024-03-15, 2024-01-01, 2024-06-30]. Print sorted list.
testCode:
import datetime
dates = [datetime.date(2024, 3, 15), datetime.date(2024, 1, 1), datetime.date(2024, 6, 30)]
{user_code}
print(sorted_dates)

title: Generate Date Range
description: Generate list of dates from 2024-01-01 to 2024-01-05 (inclusive). Print list.

title: Calendar Module
description: Import calendar and get month name for month 3. Print it.

title: Extract Time from DateTime
description: Extract time from datetime 2024-01-01 14:30:00. Print time.

title: Extract Date from DateTime
description: Extract date from datetime 2024-01-01 14:30:00. Print date.

title: Birthday This Year
description: Get birthday (March 15) in year 2024 from birthdate 2000-03-15. Print result.
hints: Keeps month and day, changes year

title: Calculate Elapsed Time
description: Calculate hours:minutes between 09:30 and 17:45. Print as string 'H:MM'.
hints: Calculate hours and minutes from seconds

title: Microseconds
description: Create datetime with microseconds. Print microsecond value.
